Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...Choose whatever you please. If there is anything you want, I'll give it all to you. You can think of it as a reward for your good luck, or else as proper compensation for how you've answered to my demands."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It can be anything. If there is anything you desire, I will give you it all. You may think of it as a reward for your good luck, or as a proper trade for my demands."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Anything is fine. If there is anything you want, I'll give you it all. You can think of it as my reward for your good luck, and as a proper trade for my demands."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……何でも良い。そなたが望む物があるならば、その全てを与えよう。その強運への褒美と思うも良かろうし、妾の求めに対する正当な対価と考えても良い。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……何でも良い。そなたが望む物があるならば、その全てを与えよう。その強運への褒美と思うも良かろうし、妾の求めに対する正当な対価と考えても良い」
Russian (RU): "......Всё в порядке. Если ты чего‐нибудь желаешь, я дам тебе всё это. Ты можешь думать об этом как о моей награде за твою удачу, а так же об обмене за мои требования."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Poderia ser qualquer coisa. Se tiver qualquer coisa que deseje, eu concederei a você. Você pode pensar nisso como uma recompensa pela sua boa sorte ou uma adequada troca pelas minhas demandas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……無論什麼都行。只要是汝想要之物，妾身全都給予。把這當成對汝強運的獎賞也好，想成對妾身所求之物的正當等價報酬也行。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……无论什么都行。只要是汝想要之物，妾身全都给予。把这当成对汝强运的奖赏也好，想成对妾身所求之物的正当等价报酬也行。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Va bene qualsiasi cosa. Se c'è qualcosa che desideri, te la darò tutta. {n}Puoi considerarla la mia ricompensa per la tua buona sorte, e un giusto scambio per le mie richieste."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Scegli pure qualsiasi cosa. Se c'è qualcosa che desideri, io te la concederò. Considerala una ricompensa della tua buona sorte, oppure vedila come uno scambio equo per le mie richieste."
Turkish (TR): "......Her şey olabilir. Arzu ettiğin bir şey varsa, tamamını sana vereceğim. Bunu iyi şansının bir ödülü ya da taleplerime karşılık uygun bir değiş tokuş olarak düşünebilirsin."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "It may have been a truly trivial matter from your perspective. However, the deal was important enough to me to be deserving of this reward."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "I am commonly called the Golden Witch. Bestowing a mountain of gold, like the one I gave Kinzo, is trivial to me. ...After all, you can measure all the pleasures of the human world with money. Therefore, gold is no more or less than the manifestation of the human world's pleasures."
Umineko Project (UP): "I am commonly called the Golden Witch. Bestowing a mountain of gold, like I gave to Kinzo, is no problem for me. ......After all, every pleasure of the human world can be expressed in terms of cash. Put another way, gold is human pleasure itself."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I am commonly called the Golden Witch. Bestowing a mountain of gold, like I gave to Kinzo, is no problem for me. ......In any event, you can convert all pleasures of the human world into money. Therefore, gold is equal to all the pleasures of the human world."
PC Japanese (JP): 「妾の通り名は黄金の魔女。金蔵に与えたように、山成す黄金を与えることは造作もない。……何しろ、人の世の快楽は全てカネで換算できる。即ち、黄金こそが人の世の快楽そのものなのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「妾の通り名は黄金の魔女。金蔵に与えたように、山成す黄金を与えることは造作もない。……何しろ、人の世の快楽は全てカネで換算できる。即ち、黄金こそが人の世の快楽そのものなのだ」
Russian (RU): "Меня обычно величают Золотой Ведьмой. Подарить гору золота, вроде той, что дала Кинзо, для меня не проблема. ......В любом случае, ты можешь обратить все удовольствия человеческого мира в деньги. Поэтому золото равнозначно всем удовольствиям человеческого мира."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sou comumente chamada de Bruxa Dourada. Conferir uma montanha de ouro, assim como eu dei a Kinzo, não é um problema para mim. ......Afinal, todo o prazer do mundo humano pode ser expressado em termos de dinheiro. Colocando de outra forma, o ouro em si é o prazer humano."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「妾身的名號為黃金的魔女。就像給過金藏一樣，妾身要給予堆成山的黃金可一點都不費事。……畢竟，人世的快樂全都可以用錢來換算。換言之，黃金即正是人世的快樂。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「妾身的名号为黄金的魔女。就像给过金藏一样，妾身要给予堆成山的黄金可一点都不费事。……毕竟，人世的快乐全都可以用钱来换算。换言之，黄金即正是人世的快乐。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sono largamente conosciuta come la Strega Dorata. Conferire a qualcuno una montagna d'oro, come quella che ho dato a Kinzo, non è difficile per me. {n}Ad ogni modo, puoi ricondurre tutti i piaceri del mondo degli uomini al danaro. Di conseguenza, l'oro equivale a tutti i piaceri del mondo degli uomini."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Solitamente sono conosciuta come la Strega Dorata. Non è un problema per me donare una montagna d'oro come feci con Kinzo... Dopotutto, tutti i piaceri del mondo umano possono essere valutati in termini di denaro. Ergo, l'oro stesso è la fonte di ogni piacere del mondo umano."
Turkish (TR): "Bana genellikle Altın Cadı olarak hitap edilir. Kinzo'ya bahşettiğim gibi bir dağ dolusu altın bahşetmek benim için hiç sorun değil. ......Sonuçta, insan dünyasının her zevki para cinsinden ifade edilebilir. Başka bir deyişle, altın insan zevkinin bizzat kendisidir."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Can you imagine it? A mountain of gold that you couldn't use up as long as you lived."
Umineko Project (UP): "Can you imagine? A mountain of gold that you couldn't use up as long as you lived."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...However, the human world is difficult. I know there are some things that cannot be settled, no matter how high into the sky you pile up gold. I know there are cracks that cannot be filled.
Umineko Project (UP): "......However, the human world is difficult. I know that there are some things that cannot be satisfied no matter how high into the sky you pile up gold. I know that there are cracks that can't be filled."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......However, the human world is difficult. I know that there are some things that cannot be satisfied no matter how high into the sky you pile up gold. I know that there are cracks that can't be filled.
PC Japanese (JP): 「……しかし、人の世は難しい。どれほど空高く積み上げた黄金であろうとも、満たされぬものがあることを知っている。埋められぬ隙間があることを知っている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……しかし、人の世は難しい。どれほど空高く積み上げた黄金であろうとも、満たされぬものがあることを知っている。埋められぬ隙間があることを知っている」
Russian (RU): "......Однако, человеческий мир сложен. Я знаю, что есть некоторые вещи, которые невозможно исполнить, даже если твоя гора золота будет доставать до неба. Я знаю, что есть трещины, которые нельзя заполнить."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Contudo, o mundo humano é difícil. Eu sei que existem algumas coisas que não podem ser realizadas, não importando o quão alto a sua pilha de ouro vá através do céu. Eu sei que existem rachaduras que não podem ser preenchidas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……然而，人世很是複雜。妾身知道，無論把黃金堆高到有多接近天空，都有無法滿足之物。都有無法埋住的裂痕。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……然而，人世很是复杂。妾身知道，无论把黄金堆高到有多接近天空，都有无法满足之物。都有无法埋住的裂痕。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Tuttavia, il mondo degli esseri umani è complesso. So che ci sono cose che non si possono ottenere anche se ammassassi tanto oro da toccare il cielo. So che ci sono vuoti che non si possono riempire.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Tuttavia, il mondo umano è intricato. Sono consapevole che, anche ammassando talmente tanto oro da arrivare al cielo, esistono cose che esso non può procurare. So che ci sono fratture che non possono essere colmate."
Turkish (TR): "......Fakat insan dünyası zordur. Gökyüzüne doğru ne kadar altın yığarsan yığ, bazı şeylerin tatmin edilemeyeceğini biliyorum. Doldurulamayacak çatlaklar olduğunu biliyorum."

Steam (ST): I won't make light of that, which is why this is a gift that only a witch such as I can give."
Umineko Project (UP): "I won't make light of that, and in fact, I believe that is why this is a gift that only a witch such as I can give."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I won't make light of that, which is why this is a gift that only a witch such as I can give."

Russian (RU): "Я не буду шутить над этим, вот почему такой подарок может сделать лишь такая ведьма, как я."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu não vou esclarecer isso e, de fato, acredito que é por isso que este é um presente que apenas uma bruxa como eu pode dar."

Steam (ST): "...Why don't I fill those cracks in for you? Yes, how about this. It's something only I can give. You should be very happy."

Steam (ST): "...No need to thank me out loud. I can tell right away. It's written on your face and in the corners of your heart, *cackle*cackle*!"

Steam (ST): Rosa felt a touch of discomfort at this witch, who kept on talking even though Rosa hadn't uttered a single word, but since she still couldn't manage to speak...and was so helpless that it was difficult to even move a finger, she couldn't do anything but listen.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa felt a touch of discomfort at this witch, who kept on talking even though she herself hadn't uttered a single word, but since she still couldn't speak well, and found it difficult even to move a finger, she could do nothing about it, and was unable to do anything but listen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa felt a touch of discomfort at this witch, who kept on talking even though Rosa hadn't uttered a single word, but since she still couldn't speak well, and was so helpless that it was difficult for her even to move a finger, she couldn't do anything but listen.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は、自分は一言も発してないにもかかわらず、勝手に話を進める魔女に一抹の不安を覚えましたが、言葉もうまく話せず、指一本動かすのにも難儀する有様では、どうすることもできず、ただ耳を傾けることしかできませんでした。
Russian (RU): Роза ощутила лёгкий дискомфорт от этой ведьмы, которая всё продолжала говорить, хотя Роза не произнесла ни одного слова, но так как она не могла ничего ответить, и была настолько беспомощна, что даже с трудом шевелила пальцем, она не могла ничего поделать, кроме как слушать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa sentiu um toque de desconforto em relação à bruxa, que continuava a falar mesmo sem ela ter dito uma única palavra, mas como ela ainda não conseguia falar claramente, e encontrou uma dificuldade ainda maior só para mexer o dedo, ela não pôde fazer nada quanto aquilo, sendo obrigada a apenas continuar a ouvir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座對明明自己尚未發過一言，卻還是顧自往下講的魔女，感到了一縷不安，不過，就憑這副連話都沒法好好說，動一根手指都十分困難的樣子，她什麼都做不了，只能去側耳傾聽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座对明明自己尚未发过一言，却还是顾自往下讲的魔女，感到了一缕不安，不过，就凭这副连话都没法好好说，动一根手指都十分困难的样子，她什么都做不了，只能去侧耳倾听。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa si sentì un po' a disagio davanti a questa strega, che continuava a parlare anche se Rosa non aveva pronunciato nemmeno una parola, ma siccome non riusciva ancora a parlare bene, ed era così debole che anche alzare un dito le era difficile, non le restava altro da fare che ascoltare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa provò una punta di disagio nei confronti della strega, la quale continuava a parlare per conto suo nonostante lei non avesse proferito parola, ma siccome non riusciva ancora a parlare bene, ed era in condizioni per cui avrebbe faticato anche solo ad alzare un dito, non potè far altro che starla ad ascoltare.
Turkish (TR): Rosa, kendisi tek bir kelime bile etmediği halde, konuşmaya devam eden bu cadı karşısında bir nebze huzursuz olmuştu, ama hâlâ iyi konuşamadığı ve parmağını bile oynatmakta zorlandığı için elinden bir şey gelmiyor, ve dinlemekten başka bir şey yapamıyordu.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "How far must the deep wounds in your heart recede before they can be healed?
Umineko Project (UP): "How far back must I trace the deep wounds in your heart in order to heal them?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そなたの深き心の傷はどこまで遡れば癒せるのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そなたの深き心の傷はどこまで遡れば癒せるのか」
Russian (RU): "Насколько же глубоки раны в твоём сердце, прежде чем они смогут затянуться?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O quanto para trás eu devo traçar as feridas em seu coração para que eu possa curá‐las?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「汝那深深的心傷是要追溯到多深才能治癒呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「汝那深深的心伤是要追溯到多深才能治愈呢？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quanto devono recedere le ferite profonde che hai nel cuore prima di poter essere guarite?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Quanto indietro dovrò andare nel tempo affinché le profonde cicatrici della tua anima possano guarire...?"
Turkish (TR): "Kalbindeki derin yaraları iyileştirmek için ne kadar eskiye gitmeliyim?"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): ......This is... ......deep... quite deep indeed. ...Sometimes, wounds close up while a fragment of foreign matter remains inside. ...Even when such wounds appear to have healed, they continue to throb for all eternity. Sometimes, you have to open the wound once more in order to heal it completely."
Umineko Project (UP): "......This is......deep, deep. ......Sometimes, wounds close up while a fragment of something is still inside. ...Even when those wounds appear to have healed, they will continue to throb for all eternity. Sometimes you have to open the wound once to completely heal it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........This is, .........deep, deep. ......Sometimes, wounds close up while a fragment of something is still inside. ...Even when those wounds appear to have healed, they will continue to throb for all eternity. Sometimes you have to open the wound once to completely heal it."
PC Japanese (JP): ………これは、………深い、深い。……時に、破片を飲み込んだまま傷口が閉じてしまうこともある。…そういう傷は見た目には癒えていても、永遠に疼きを感じ続けるものだ。完全に治すために、今一度、傷口を開くこともあろう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……これは、……深い、深い。……時に、破片を飲み込んだまま傷口が閉じてしまうこともある。…そういう傷は見た目には癒えていても、永遠に疼きを感じ続けるものだ。完全に治すために、今一度、傷口を開くこともあろう」
Russian (RU): ".........Они... глубоки... глубоки. ......Иногда раны затягиваются в то время как внутри может остаться инородный объект. ...Даже когда кажется, что эти раны зажили, они будут продолжать пульсировать целую вечность. Иногда требуется один раз вскрыть рану, чтобы полностью излечить её."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Isso é......profundo, profundo. ......Algumas vezes, feridas fecham, ainda com fragmentos dentro delas. ...Mesmo quando essas feridas aparentam terem sido curadas, elas continuam a pulsar por toda a eternidade. Tem vezes que você precisa abri‐las novamente para curá‐las por completo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………這可是，………好深，好深呢。……有時，也是會有埋著碎片就合起了傷口的情況。…這種傷縱然在表面上看是癒合了，但卻是會永遠地感受到疼痛。為了完全治好它，有時也得再一次地切開這傷口呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………这可是，………好深，好深呢。……有时，也是会有埋着碎片就合起了伤口的情况。…这种伤纵然在表面上看是愈合了，但却是会永远地感受到疼痛。为了完全治好它，有时也得再一次地切开这伤口呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Questa ferita è... profonda, profonda. ... Talvolta, le ferite si chiudono anche se vi sono rimasti dei detriti all'interno. ... Nonostante queste ferite sembrino essersi rimarginate, continueranno a far male per sempre. Alcune volte occorre riaprire la ferita un'altra volta per guarirla."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Questa qui... è profonda... molto profonda... Talvolta, gli squarci delle ferite si chiudono anche se al loro interno contengono ancora delle schegge... Anche se all'apparenza tali lesioni sembrano rimarginate, continueranno a causare dolore per sempre. Ci sono casi in cui, per guarirle del tutto, occorre aprire lo squarcio un'altra volta."
Turkish (TR): "......Bu......derin, çok derin. ......Bazen yaralar, içinde hala bir şeylerin parçası varken kapanır. ...Bu yaralar iyileşmiş gibi görünse bile, sonsuza kadar sızlamaya devam edecektir. Bazen yarayı tamamen iyileştirmek için bir kez açmak gerekir."

Steam (ST): As the witch spoke, she stared deep into Rosa's eyes.
Umineko Project (UP): As the witch spoke, she was staring deep into Rosa's eyes.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the witch spoke, she stared deep into Rosa's eyes.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女はそう語りながら、楼座の瞳の奥深くを覗き込みます。
Russian (RU): Пока ведьма говорила, она смотрела глубоко в глаза Розы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa olhava profundamente nos olhos de Rosa enquanto falava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女邊如此述說著，邊貼近臉窺視樓座的瞳孔深處。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女边如此述说着，边贴近脸窥视楼座的瞳孔深处。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La strega fissava profondamente gli occhi di Rosa mentre parlava.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Mentre discorreva, la strega squadrava in profondità gli occhi di Rosa.
Turkish (TR): Cadı konuşurken Rosa'nın gözlerinin derinliklerine bakıyordu.

Steam (ST): ...What in the world...was she peering at? Rosa felt uncomfortable, but she couldn't look away.
Umineko Project (UP): ......What in the world...was she peering at? Rosa felt uncomfortable, but she couldn't look away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......What in the world, ...was she peering at? Rosa felt uncomfortable, but she couldn't look away.
PC Japanese (JP): ……一体、何を覗き見られているのか。楼座は不安になりますが、目を逸らすことはできませんでした。
Russian (RU): ......Что же такого... она там выискивала? Роза почувствовала себя неловко, но не могла отвести взгляд.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O que ela estava...espreitando através deles? Rosa sentiu‐se desconfortável, mas ela não conseguia deixar de olhar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……自己到底是在被窺視著些什麼呢？儘管樓座甚是不安，但是她卻沒法挪開眼珠。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……自己到底是在被窥视着些什么呢？尽管楼座甚是不安，但是她却没法挪开眼珠。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Cosa mai... sta cercando di scorgere? Rosa era a disagio, ma non poteva distogliere lo sguardo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Cosa diavolo... stava scrutando? Rosa era nervosa, ma non riusciva a distogliere lo sguardo.
Turkish (TR): ......Neye...gözünü dikmişti? Rosa kendini huzursuz hissediyordu ama gözlerini kaçıramıyordu.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "......So, your pain was already fated by the time of your birth. ...How heart-breaking. ...You don't have to say it. I understand. ...I understand..."
Umineko Project (UP): "............So this pain of yours was preordained from your very birth. ...How heart‐breaking. ...You don't have to say it. I understand. ......I understand......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............So your pain, is being stuck with a fate from the time you were born. ...How heart-breaking. ...You don't have to say it. I understand. ......I understand......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………そなたの痛みは、すでに生まれながらにして運命付けられたものか。…これは何とも辛いものよ。…言わずとも良い。わかる。……わかる……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………そなたの痛みは、すでに生まれながらにして運命付けられたものか。…これは何とも辛いものよ。…言わずとも良い。わかる。……わかる……」
Russian (RU): "............Так твоя боль началась ещё со времени твоего рождения. ...Как душераздирающе. ...Тебе не нужно говорить об этом. Я понимаю. ......Я понимаю..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Parece que sua dor já estava predestinada desde o seu nascimento. ...Isto é mesmo deplorável. ...Você não precisa dizer. Eu entendo. ......Eu entendo......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………汝的痛楚，是在汝出生時即已被命運注定了的東西麼。…這可是何等的辛酸啊。…不用開口。妾身明白。……明白……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………汝的痛楚，是在汝出生时即已被命运注定了的东西么。…这可是何等的辛酸啊。…不用开口。妾身明白。……明白……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... E così il tuo dolore è quello di essere impigliata nello stesso destino da quando sei nata. ... Che tristezza. ... Non c'è bisogno che tu parli. Capisco. {n}Io capisco..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...E così, il tuo dolore era predestinato sin dalla tua nascita...? Che cosa struggente... Non serve che tu parli. Ho capito... Ho capito..."
Turkish (TR): "............Yani bu acın doğduğun andan itibaren kaderinde vardı. ...Ne kadar kalp parçalayıcı. ...Söylemek zorunda değilsin. Anlıyorum. ......Anlıyorum......"

Steam (ST): Rosa was gradually being sucked into the witch's eyes.
Umineko Project (UP): Gradually, Rosa, in turn, was drawn into the witch's eyes.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, Rosa was once again sucked into the witch's eyes.
PC Japanese (JP): 次第に、楼座もまた魔女の瞳の中に飲み込まれていきました。
Russian (RU): Затем Розу снова затянуло во взгляд ведьмы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gradualmente, Rosa foi sendo absorvida pelo olhar da bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 漸漸地，樓座被吸進了魔女的瞳孔之中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 渐渐地，楼座被吸进了魔女的瞳孔之中。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi, Rosa fu di nuovo risucchiata dagli occhi della strega.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Man mano, Rosa venne nuovamente risucchiata dagli occhi della strega.
Turkish (TR): Yavaş yavaş, Rosa da cadının gözlerinin cazibesine kapıldı.

Steam (ST): Then, the world grew dark, spinning round and round as she was sucked in...
Umineko Project (UP): Gradually, the world grew dark, spinning round and round as she was sucked in...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, the world grew dark, spinning round and round as she was sucked in...
PC Japanese (JP): 次第に、世界が暗く、ぐるぐると回って飲み込まれていきます…。
Russian (RU): А потом мир потемнел, завертелся волчком и её поглотило...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gradualmente, o mundo foi escurecendo, girando e girando como se ela estivesse sendo consumida...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 漸漸地，世界越變越暗，旋轉著地卷噬而去…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 渐渐地，世界越变越暗，旋转着地卷噬而去…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E poi, il mondo si fece scuro, girando ancora e ancora mentre lei ne veniva risucchiata...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E successivamente, il mondo attorno a lei si rabbuiò, per poi ruotare attorno a lei mentre veniva trascinata via...
Turkish (TR): Yavaş yavaş, dünya karanlığa büründü, o içine çekildikçe etraf dönmeye başladı...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): Rosa, Rosa. Why are you such an idiot?
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa, Rosa. Why are you such an idiot?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa, Rosa. Why are you such an idiot?
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座、楼座。どうしてお前はそんなに馬鹿なのか。
Russian (RU): Роза, Роза. Почему ты такая бестолковая?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa, Rosa. Por que você é tão idiota?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座，樓座。為什麼你會這麼笨呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座，楼座。为什么你会这么笨呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa, Rosa. Perché sei così stupida?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): [=ITA]
Turkish (TR): Rosa, Rosa. Neden bu kadar aptalsın?

Steam (ST): Oh, that's Krauss nii-san's voice. Krauss nii-san is a real adult, so he's very smart. So he hated the stupid kid, Rosa.
Umineko Project (UP): Oh, that's Krauss nii‐san's voice.{n}Krauss nii‐san is very grown‐up, so he's very smart.{n}So he hated the stupid kid Rosa.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Oh, that's Krauss nii-san's voice. Krauss nii-san is a real adult, so he's very smart. So he hated the stupid kid Rosa.
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、これは蔵臼兄さんの声です。蔵臼兄さんはとても大人だからとても頭がいいのです。だから馬鹿で子どもな楼座が大嫌いでした。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): あぁ、これは蔵臼兄さんの声です。{n}蔵臼兄さんはとても大人だからとても頭がいいのです。{n}だから馬鹿で子どもな楼座が大嫌いでした。
Russian (RU): Ох, это голос Краусса нии‐сана.{n}Краусс нии‐сан настоящий взрослый, поэтому он очень умный.{n}Так что он ненавидел глупого ребёнка Розу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ah, essa é a voz do Krauss nii‐san.{n}O Krauss nii‐san é bem maduro, e também muito inteligente.{n}Por isso, ele odeia crianças estúpidas como Rosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊啊，這是藏臼哥的聲音。{n}藏臼哥因為很成熟所以腦子很好。{n}所以最討厭又笨又孩子氣的樓座了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊啊，这是藏臼哥的声音。{n}藏臼哥因为很成熟所以脑子很好。{n}所以最讨厌又笨又孩子气的楼座了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Oh, è la voce di Krauss nii-san. Krauss nii-san è un vero adulto, perciò è molto intelligente. Quindi detestava Rosa, la stupida bambina.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ah, quella era la voce di mio fratello Klaus.{n}Visto che era molto grande d'età, mio fratello Klaus era molto intelligente.{n}Perciò, lui detestava la stupida, piccola Rosa.
Turkish (TR): Oh, bu Krauss nii-san'ın sesi.{n}Krauss nii-san çok yetişkin, yani çok akıllı.{n}Bu yüzden, aptal çocuk Rosa'dan nefret ederdi.

Steam (ST): He was a very scary person. I was often hit, and my toys were taken from me and broken.
Umineko Project (UP): And he was a very scary person, and I was often hit, and my toys were taken from me and broken.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He was a very scary person. I was often hit, and my toys were taken from me and broken.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてとても怖い人で、よく叩かれたり、玩具を取り上げられて壊したりされました。
Russian (RU): Он был страшным человеком. Меня часто били, а мои игрушки забирали и ломали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele era uma pessoa muito assustadora, e muitas vezes eu era atingida e meus brinquedos tomados de mim e quebrados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哥是非常可怕的人，經常打我，把我的玩具搶走弄壞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 哥是非常可怕的人，经常打我，把我的玩具抢走弄坏。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era una persona davvero spaventosa. Venivo picchiata spesso, e miei giocattoli mi venivano portati via e rotti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era una persona davvero terrificante: mi picchiava spesso, e dopo avermi sequestrato i giocattoli, me li rompeva.
Turkish (TR): Çok korkutucu bir insandı ve bana sık sık vururdu, oyuncaklarımı elimden alır ve kırardı.

Steam (ST): I was apparently being punished for something bad I'd done, but I never really understood what it was, or why I was being punished.
Umineko Project (UP): He would say it was a punishment because I did something bad, but I didn't really understand what that was, or why I was being punished.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had seemed like I was being punished for something bad I'd done, but I hadn't really understood what it was, or why I was being punished.
PC Japanese (JP): それは自分が何か悪いことをしたからの罰らしいのですが、何を犯したから何を罰せられるのかよくわかりませんでした。
Russian (RU): Казалось, что меня наказывают за совершенный мною проступок, но я действительно не понимала, в чём провинилась, или почему меня наказывают.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele dizia que era uma punição por eu ter feito algo de errado, mas eu realmente não entendia o que estava errado ou por qual motivo eu estava sendo punida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然這好像是因為我做錯了什麼而接受的懲罰，但是我不清楚是犯了什麼錯而要受什麼罰。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然这好像是因为我做错了什么而接受的惩罚，但是我不清楚是犯了什么错而要受什么罚。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembrava una punizione per qualcosa di male che avevo fatto, ma non capivo affatto di cosa si trattasse, o perché stavo venendo punita.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sembrava che mi stesse punendo per aver fatto qualcosa di male, ma non capivo affatto in cosa avevo sbagliato, né perché stessi venendo punita.
Turkish (TR): Kötü bir şey yaptığım için cezalandırıldığımı söylerdi ama ben ne yaptığımı ya da neden cezalandırıldığımı gerçekten anlayamazdım.

Steam (ST): I was always punished suddenly and then later told what the punishment was for, in a forced manner, but it was always something I didn't remember doing.
Umineko Project (UP): I was always punished suddenly, and then after the fact, I was told in a contrived manner that it was a punishment for something or other, but it was always something I didn't remember doing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I was always punished suddenly and then later told what the punishment was for, in a forced manner, but it was always something I didn't remember doing.
PC Japanese (JP): いつも突然に罰せられ、その後になって、取って付けたようにそれが何かの罰であると言われるのですが、それはいつも身に覚えのないことでした。
Russian (RU): Меня всегда наказывали внезапно, а потом в неестественной манере рассказывали, за что именно, но я действительно не помнила, чтобы я что‐нибудь натворила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu sempre era punida de repente, e depois, era dito de forma artificial que era uma punição, mas era sempre algo que eu não lembrava de ter feito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 總是突然受罰，之後，又被哥生搬硬套上似的說這是對於什麼的懲罰，可這些事情，每次都是我不根本記得有做過的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 总是突然受罚，之后，又被哥生搬硬套上似的说这是对于什么的惩罚，可这些事情，每次都是我不根本记得有做过的事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Venivo sempre punita all'improvviso e soltanto dopo mi era detto a cosa era dovuta la punizione, in modo forzato, ma era sempre qualcosa che non ricordavo di aver fatto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il castigo avveniva sempre quando non me l'aspettavo, e solo in seguito mi veniva detto in maniera forzata il motivo della punizione, ma era sempre qualcosa che non ricordavo di aver fatto...

Umineko Project (UP): ......So I really hated Krauss nii‐san.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): Rosa, Rosa. Why are you such an idiot?
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa, Rosa. Why are you such an idiot?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa, Rosa. Why are you such an idiot?
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座、楼座。どうしてお前はそんなに馬鹿なのか。
Russian (RU): Роза, Роза. Почему ты такая идиотка?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa, Rosa. Por que você é tão idiota?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座，樓座。為什麼你會這麼笨呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座，楼座。为什么你会这么笨呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa, Rosa. Perché sei così stupida?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): [=ITA]
Turkish (TR): Rosa, Rosa. Neden bu kadar aptalsın?

Steam (ST): Oh, that's Eva nee-san's voice. Eva nee-san is a real adult, so she's very smart. So she hated the stupid kid, Rosa.
Umineko Project (UP): Oh, that's Eva nee‐san's voice.{n}Eva nee‐san is very grown‐up, so she's very smart.{n}So she hated the stupid kid Rosa.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Oh, that's Eva nee-san's voice. Eva nee-san is a real adult, so she's very smart. So she hated the stupid kid Rosa.
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、これは絵羽姉さんの声です。絵羽姉さんはとても大人だからとても頭がいいのです。だから馬鹿で子どもな楼座が大嫌いでした。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): あぁ、これは絵羽姉さんの声です。{n}絵羽姉さんはとても大人だからとても頭がいいのです。{n}だから馬鹿で子どもな楼座が大嫌いでした。
Russian (RU): Ох, это голос Евы нее‐сан.{n}Ева нее‐сан по‐настоящему взрослая, поэтому она очень умна.{n}Как же она ненавидела тупого ребёнка Розу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ah, é a voz da Eva nee‐san.{n}A Eva nee‐san é bem madura, e também muito inteligente.{n}Por isso, ele odeia crianças estúpidas como Rosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊啊，這是繪羽姐姐的聲音。{n}繪羽姐姐因為很成熟所以腦子很好。{n}所以最討厭又笨又孩子氣的樓座了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊啊，这是绘羽姐姐的声音。{n}绘羽姐姐因为很成熟所以脑子很好。{n}所以最讨厌又笨又孩子气的楼座了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Oh, è la voce di Eva Nee-san. Eva Nee-san è una vera adulta, perciò è molto intelligente. Quindi detestava Rosa, la stupida bambina.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ah, quella era la voce di mia sorella Eva.{n}Visto che era molto grande d'età, mia sorella Eva era molto intelligente.{n}Perciò, lei detestava la stupida, piccola Rosa.
Turkish (TR): Oh, bu Eva nee-san'ın sesi.{n}Eva nee-san çok yetişkin, yani çok akıllı.{n}Bu yüzden, aptal çocuk Rosa'dan nefret ederdi.

Steam (ST): She was always a very sly person, and she often lied to me, tricked me, bullied me all the time.
Umineko Project (UP): And she was a very sly person, and I was often lied to, tricked, and bullied a lot.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She was always a very sly person, and she often lied to me, tricked me, bullied me all time.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてとても狡賢い人で、よく嘘を吐かれたり、騙されたりしてたくさん虐められました。
Russian (RU): Она была очень хитрым человеком, и лгала мне, обманывала меня, постоянно издевалась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela era uma pessoa muito maliciosa, e muitas vezes ela mentia para mim, me enganava e me maltratava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 姐是非常狡猾的人，經常唬我、騙我，使我吃了不少苦頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 姐是非常狡猾的人，经常唬我、骗我，使我吃了不少苦头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era sempre stata una persona molto astuta, e spesso mi mentiva, mi ingannava, mi maltrattava tutto il tempo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era una persona molto scaltra: mi raccontava tante bugie, m'ingannava, e mi maltrattava molte volte.
Turkish (TR): Çok kurnaz bir insandı ve bana sık sık yalan söyler, kandırır ve zorbalık yapardı.

Steam (ST): Apparently I was stupid, and she said it was only natural for stupid people to be swindled by those smarter than them.
Umineko Project (UP): She would say it was because I was stupid, and that it was only natural for stupid people to be swindled by those smarter than them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had seemed like I was stupid, and she said it was only natural for stupid people to be swindled by those better than them.
PC Japanese (JP): それは自分の頭が悪いかららしく、頭が悪い人は、より良い人に詐取されて当然なのだと言っていました。
Russian (RU): По‐видимому я была глупа, и однажды она сказала мне, что вполне естественно, что глупые люди будут обмануты теми, кто превосходит их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela dizia isso porque eu sou estúpida, e é natural que pessoas estúpidas sejam enganadas por pessoas que são mais inteligentes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 還說這是因為我腦子不好，腦子笨的人，活該被更聰明的人詐取。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 还说这是因为我脑子不好，脑子笨的人，活该被更聪明的人诈取。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembravo stupida, e lei mi disse che era naturale che le persone stupide venissero ingannate da quelli che erano meglio di loro.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Facevo la figura dell'idiota, e lei mi diceva che era normale che gli idioti venissero raggirati da chi era migliore di loro.
Turkish (TR): Bana bunun aptal olduğum için olduğunu ve aptal insanların kendilerinden daha zeki olanlar tarafından kandırılmasının doğal olduğunu söylerdi.

Steam (ST): So I wanted to become a wise person like Eva nee-san, and listened to what she said, but when I obeyed her, for some reason, someone always got really mad at me.
Umineko Project (UP): So I wanted to become a wise person like Eva nee‐san, and listened to what she said, but when I obeyed her, for some reason, someone always got really mad at me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So I wanted to become a wise person like Eva nee-san, and listened to what she said, but when I obeyed her, for some reason, someone always got really mad at me.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、絵羽姉さんのような賢い人になりたいと思い、言うことを聞くのですが、従うとなぜかいつも誰かに酷く怒られました。
Russian (RU): Поэтому я хотела стать мудрым человеком как Ева нее‐сан, и слушала то, что она мне говорила, но когда я её слушалась, то по какой то причине кто‐нибудь другой начинал злиться на меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, eu queria me tornar uma pessoa sábia como a Eva nee‐san, e ouvia o que ela dizia. Mas quando eu obedecia o que ela dizia, por alguma razão, ela ficava brava comigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 於是，我也想變成像繪羽姐姐那樣聰明的人，但一聽姐姐的話照辦，就不知為何總是會被其他人罵個狗血淋頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 于是，我也想变成像绘羽姐姐那样聪明的人，但一听姐姐的话照办，就不知为何总是会被其他人骂个狗血淋头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per questo volevo diventare una persona saggia come Eva Nee-san, e ascoltavo tutto quello che diceva, ma quando le obbedivo, per qualche motivo, c'era sempre qualcuno che si arrabbiava tantissimo con me.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): D'altra parte, io volevo diventare sveglia come mia sorella Eva, e ascoltavo quello che diceva, ma quando le obbedivo, per qualche ragione c'era sempre qualcuno che si imbufaliva con me...
Turkish (TR): Bu yüzden Eva nee-san gibi bilge bir insan olmak istedim ve onun söylediklerini dinledim, ancak onun sözünü dinlediğimde nedense birileri bana hep çok kızdı.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando o Krauss nii‐san está por perto, ele é amigável com o Krauss nii‐san.{n}Quando a Eva nee‐san está por perto, ele é amigável com a Eva nee‐san.

Steam (ST): ...And when Krauss nii-san wasn't around, he would be violent like Krauss nii-san, and when Eva nee-san wasn't around, he would play dirty like Eva nee-san.
Umineko Project (UP): ...And when Krauss nii‐san wasn't around, he was violent like Krauss nii‐san, and when Eva nee‐san wasn't around, he played dirty like Eva nee‐san.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And when Krauss nii-san wasn't around, he was violent like Krauss nii-san, and when Eva nee-san wasn't around he played dirty like Eva nee-san.
PC Japanese (JP): …そして、蔵臼兄さんがいない時には蔵臼兄さんのように乱暴し、絵羽姉さんがいない時には絵羽姉さんのようにズルでした。
Russian (RU): ...А когда Краусса нии‐сана не было рядом, он был суров как Краусс нии‐сан. А когда Евы нее‐сан не было рядом, он вёл грязную игру как Ева нее‐сан.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...E quando o Krauss nii‐san não está por perto, ele é violento assim como o Krauss nii‐san. Quando a Eva nee‐san não está por perto, ele é injusto assim como a Eva nee‐san.

Turkish (TR): ...Krauss nii-san etrafta olmadığında, Krauss nii-san gibi şiddet yanlısıydı, ve Eva nee-san etrafta olmadığında, Eva nee-san gibi çirkin davranırdı.

Steam (ST): And even though he was also bullied most of the time, when Krauss nii-san and Eva nee-san weren't around, he gave me two people's worth of bullying.
Umineko Project (UP): And even though he too was bullied most of the time, when Krauss nii‐san and Eva nee‐san weren't around, he gave me two people's worth of bullying.

Russian (RU): И даже при том, что над ним тоже издевались большую часть времени, когда Краусса нии‐сана и Евы нее‐сан не было рядом, он издевался за двоих.

Steam (ST): It's common for unfair things to happen between kids. And you mustn't hold onto grudges for such things forever.
Umineko Project (UP): Quite a lot of unfair things happen when you're a kid.{n}And you can't drag them out forever.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A large amount of unreasonable things happened when I was a kid. And that couldn't be dragged out forever.
PC Japanese (JP): 子どもの頃には少なからずの理不尽なこともあるものです。そして、それをいつまでも引き摺っていてはいけない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 子どもの頃には少なからずの理不尽なこともあるものです。{n}そして、それをいつまでも引き摺っていてはいけない。
Russian (RU): Много чего плохого случилось во время моего детства.{n}И это никогда не забудется.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Muitas coisas injustas acontecem quando você é criança.{n}E você não pode guardar ressentimentos como esses para sempre.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 孩提時代自是會經歷不少不講理的遭遇。{n}這些，可不能總是念念不忘。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 孩提时代自是会经历不少不讲理的遭遇。{n}这些，可不能总是念念不忘。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quand'ero piccola successero un sacco di cose assurde. Ma non potevo rimuginarci per sempre.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando si è bambini, capita spesso che avvengano cose ingiuste.{n}E non le si può trascinare dietro per sempre.
Turkish (TR): Çocukken pek çok adaletsiz şey olur.{n}Ve bunları sonsuza kadar uzatamazsınız.

Steam (ST): With time, those memories get buried away, and forgetting them bit by bit is supposed to be part of growing up and becoming an adult.
Umineko Project (UP): In time, you bury them away in the far reaches of memory, and forget them bit by bit; that is supposed to be what it means to grow up, and become an adult.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With time, those memories were buried away, and forgetting those bit by bit was supposed to be part of growing up and becoming an adult.
PC Japanese (JP): 時と共に記憶の彼方に葬り、それを少しずつ忘れていくのが成長であり、大人になることだったはず。
Russian (RU): Прошло время, и эти воспоминания были глубоко захоронены, и их забвение считалось ступенькой во взрослении и становлении взрослым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com o tempo, você enterra eles no fundo de sua memória e começa a esquecer pouco a pouco; isso é o que supostamente significa crescer e se tornar adulto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨著歲月流逝將之埋葬在記憶的彼方，並將之一點一點地忘去——這才是成長，這才是長大成人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着岁月流逝将之埋葬在记忆的彼方，并将之一点一点地忘去——这才是成长，这才是长大成人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Col tempo, questi ricordi furono seppelliti, e si presuppone che dimenticarli poco a poco sia parte integrante della crescita di un individuo e del diventare un adulto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Con il tempo, questi ricordi vengono sepolti, e crescendo fino all'età adulta, si suppone che vengano a poco a poco dimenticati.
Turkish (TR): Zamanla bunları hafızanın uzak köşelerine gömer ve yavaş yavaş unutursunuz; büyümek ve yetişkin olmak böyle bir şey olsa gerek.

Steam (ST): So becoming an adult is the same as separating yourself from all those memories.
Umineko Project (UP): So becoming an adult is the same thing as separating yourself from all of those memories.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So becoming an adult is the same thing as separating yourself from all of those memories.
PC Japanese (JP): だから大人になるということは、それら全ての記憶と決別することだったのです。
Russian (RU): Так что стать взрослой означает то же самое, что отделить себя от тех воспоминаний.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então se tornar adulto é a mesma coisa que separar a si mesmo de todas as suas memórias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以成為大人，就是指與所有此種記憶訣別。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以成为大人，就是指与所有此种记忆诀别。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò diventare un adulto equivale a separare te stesso da tutti questi ricordi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Pertanto, diventare adulti consiste nel distaccarsi da tutti questi ricordi.
Turkish (TR): Yani yetişkin olmak, kendinizi tüm bu anılardan soyutlamakla aynı anlama geliyor.

Steam (ST): And because of that. No matter how much time passed, Rosa couldn't become an adult.
Umineko Project (UP): And so. No matter how much time passed, Rosa couldn't become an adult.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore. No matter how much time passed, Rosa couldn't become an adult.
PC Japanese (JP): だから。楼座はいつまで経っても大人になれなかったのです。
Russian (RU): Поэтому. Независимо от того, сколько прошло времени, Роза не могла стать взрослой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, não importa quanto tempo se passe, Rosa não conseguiu se tornar uma adulta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以。樓座不管經過了多久都沒能成為大人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以。楼座不管经过了多久都没能成为大人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi. Anche dopo molto tempo, Rosa non riusciva a diventare adulta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ed è per questo che... a prescindere da quanto tempo fosse passato, Rosa non era mai riuscita a diventare un'adulta...
Turkish (TR): Ve bu nedenle, ne kadar zaman geçerse geçsin, Rosa bir türlü yetişkin olamıyordu.

Steam (ST): ...Even though she had been blessed with a daughter called Maria and was called a mother, ...she didn't at all feel like she had become an adult.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Even though she had been blessed with a daughter called Maria and was called a mother, ...she didn't at all feel like she had become an adult.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……真里亞という娘を授かり一児の母と呼ばれても、…まるで大人になれた自覚が持てなかったのです。
Russian (RU): ......Даже при том, что она была одарена дочерью по имени Мария и была названа мамой... Она никак не ощутила, что стала взрослой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mesmo tendo sido abençoada com uma filha chamada Maria e ser chamada de mãe, ...ele não sentiu como se tivesse se tornado adulta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……即便生下了名為真里亞的女兒，被稱為有一女的母親，…還是完全沒有已經是大人了的自覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……即便生下了名为真里亚的女儿，被称为有一女的母亲，…还是完全没有已经是大人了的自觉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Anche se aveva ricevuto la benedizione di avere una figlia che poi aveva chiamato Maria ed era diventata una Madre... lei non sentiva affatto di essere diventata un'adulta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Nonostante avesse ricevuto la fortuna di avere sua figlia Maria, e il resto del mondo la vedesse come una madre di una bambina... lei non percepiva affatto di essere diventata adulta.
Turkish (TR): ......Maria adında bir kızı olmasına ve kendisine anne denmesine rağmen, ...kendini hiç de yetişkin biri gibi hissetmiyordu.

Steam (ST): The witch pitied her for that.
Umineko Project (UP): The witch pitied that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The witch pitied that.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女はそれを憐れみました。
Russian (RU): Ведьма сочувствовала этому.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa lastima isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女對此表示出了憐憫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女对此表示出了怜悯。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La strega provava pietà per questo suo lato.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La strega provava compassione.
Turkish (TR): Cadı buna acımıştı.

Steam (ST): And she smiled, saying that she could heal that pain herself.
Umineko Project (UP): And she smiled, saying that she could heal that pain herself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And she smiled, saying that she could heal that pain herself.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、その痛みを自分ならば癒せると微笑みました。
Russian (RU): И она улыбнулась, сказав, что сама сможет излечить эту боль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E ela sorri, dizendo que pode curar essa dor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，露出了自己正是能治癒這份痛楚的微笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，露出了自己正是能治愈这份痛楚的微笑。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E sorrise, dicendo che avrebbe potuto guarire quel dolore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E sorridendo, le disse che avrebbe potuto curare quel dolore lei stessa.
Turkish (TR): Ve gülümseyerek bu acıyı bizzat iyileştirebileceğini söyledi.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...How can I heal you? It's possible, but not easy. ...I might rewind time, and giving you a world where you have no older siblings."
Umineko Project (UP): "......How to heal you. It's possible, but not easy. ...I could even rewind time, and give you a world where you have no elder siblings."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......How could I heal you? It's possible, but not easy. ...I could even rewind time, and give you a world where you have no older siblings."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……どうやって癒すのか。可能ではあるが簡単ではない。…時間を巻き戻し、そなたに兄と姉がいなかった世界を与えることもできよう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……どうやって癒すのか。可能ではあるが簡単ではない。…時間を巻き戻し、そなたに兄と姉がいなかった世界を与えることもできよう」
Russian (RU): "......Как я могу исцелить тебя? Это возможно, но не так просто. ...Я могла бы даже отмотать время и дать тебе мир, в котором у тебя не будет старших братьев и сестёр."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Como curar você? É possível, mas não é fácil. ...Eu poderia rebobinar o tempo e dar a você um mundo onde não tenha irmãos mais velhos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……要如何治好呢？雖然這有可能辦得到，但並不簡單。…讓時間倒轉，給予汝沒有哥哥姐姐的世界也是辦得到的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……要如何治好呢？虽然这有可能办得到，但并不简单。…让时间倒转，给予汝没有哥哥姐姐的世界也是办得到的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Come potrei guarirti? È possibile, ma non facile. ... Potrei persino far tornare indietro il tempo, e darti un mondo in cui non hai fratelli maggiori."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Come posso guarirti? È fattibile, ma non sarà facile... Potrei persino riavvolgere il tempo, e donarti un mondo in cui non hai fratelli maggiori."
Turkish (TR): "......Nasıl iyileştirebilirim? Bu mümkün, ama kolay değil. ...Zamanı geri sarabilir ve sana hiç büyük kardeşinin olmadığı bir dünya bile verebilirim."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "But that way, your "memories of being hurt by your older siblings" wouldn't remain, and in that sense, while you might call it a gift, you wouldn't be able to accept it."
Umineko Project (UP): "But that way, your "memories of being hurt by your elder siblings" wouldn't remain, and therefore, you would be unable to acknowledge it as a reward."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "But that way, your 'memories of being hurt by your older siblings' wouldn't remain, and in that sense, while you could call it a gift, you wouldn't be able to accept it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「しかしそれでは、そなたは“兄と姉に苦しめられた記憶”が残らず、ゆえにそれを以って褒美であると言われても納得はできまい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「しかしそれでは、そなたは“兄と姉に苦しめられた記憶”が残らず、ゆえにそれを以って褒美であると言われても納得はできまい」
Russian (RU): "Но в таком случае твоих 'воспоминаний о том, как ты страдала от своих старших братьев и сестры' не осталось бы, и при таком раскладе подарок теряет свой смысл, и ты бы не смогла принять его."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mas, dessa forma, as suas "memórias onde é machucada por seus irmãos mais velhos" desapareceriam, e assim sendo, você nunca seria capaz de saber que isso foi uma recompensa."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不過這樣一來，汝就不會留有“受哥哥姐姐折磨的記憶”，因而即便將此說成獎賞，也是無法令人信服的吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不过这样一来，汝就不会留有“受哥哥姐姐折磨的记忆”，因而即便将此说成奖赏，也是无法令人信服的吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ma in tal modo, i tuoi ‘ricordi di quando venivi ferita dai tuoi fratelli più grandi’ svanirebbero, e in questo senso, sebbene tu possa considerarlo comunque un dono, non saresti in grado di apprezzarlo."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ma così facendo, {i:i ricordi dei tormenti inflitti dai tuoi fratelli maggiori} svanirebbero, e di conseguenza, non saresti in grado di apprezzare la tua ricompensa, sebbene possa essere comunque considerata tale."
Turkish (TR): "Fakat bu şekilde, "büyük kardeşlerinin seni incittiğine dair anıların" olmayacak, ve dolayısıyla da bunu bir ödül olarak algılayamayacaksın."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "A person is only satisfied when their starvation is healed. But if you make it so they never starved in the first place, none of them will thank you. Just like how there are no young people who give thanks for their daily gluttony. ...Understand?"
Umineko Project (UP): "It is the relieving of hunger that brings satisfaction. If you erase hunger itself, no one will thank you. Just like how there are no young people who give thanks for their daily gluttony. ......Understand?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "If starvation is healed, that person is satisfied. Even if you erase starvation itself, no one will thank you. Just like how there are no young people who give thanks for their daily gluttony. ......Understand?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「飢えは癒してこそ満たされる。飢えそのものをなかったことにしても、誰も感謝しない。日々の飽食に感謝する若者がいないようにな。……わかるか？」
Russian (RU): "Если голод утоляется, то человек успокаивается. Даже если ты сотрёшь сам голод, никто не скажет тебе спасибо. Так же как нет молодых людей, благодарящих своё ежедневное чревоугодие. ......Понимаешь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É o alívio da fome que traz a satisfação. Se você acabar com a fome, não vai haver mais ninguém para agradecer a você. Assim como não há pessoas jovens que agradeçam pela sua gula diária. ......Consegue entender?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「有飢餓才能通過吃飽而滿足。假使將飢餓本身化為烏有，也是誰都不會感謝。就如沒有對每日飽餐抱以感謝的年輕人一樣呢。……明白嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「有饥饿才能通过吃饱而满足。假使将饥饿本身化为乌有，也是谁都不会感谢。就如没有对每日饱餐抱以感谢的年轻人一样呢。……明白吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Se la fame viene saziata, l'affamato sarà soddisfatto. Se invece arrivassi ad eliminare la fame stessa, nessuno ti ringrazierebbe. Proprio come con i giovani che non ringraziano nessuno per le loro gozzoviglie quotidiane. ... Capisci?"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "È placando la fame che si proverà soddisfazione. Non si ottengono ringraziamenti se si arriva ad eliminare la fame in sé. Così come non esistono giovani riconoscenti per il fatto che i loro bisogni siano accontentati ogni giorno... Capisci?"
Turkish (TR): "Tatmin sağlayan şey açlığın giderilmesidir. Eğer açlığın kendisini ortadan kaldırırsanız, kimse size teşekkür etmez. Tıpkı gündelik hayatlarında tıka basa yiyip içtikleri için şükreden gençlerin olmaması gibi. ......Anladın mı?"

Steam (ST): I think she's telling me something really complicated.
Umineko Project (UP): I think she just told me something really difficult.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I think she's telling me something really complicated.
PC Japanese (JP): ずいぶんと難しいことを言われたように思います。
Russian (RU): Мне кажется, она говорит мне что‐то действительно запутанное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu acho que ela acabou de me dizer algo realmente complicado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 感覺她說得好難懂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 感觉她说得好难懂。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Penso che mi stia dicendo qualcosa di molto complicato.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quello che stava dicendo mi sembrava molto complesso...
Turkish (TR): Sanırım az önce bana gerçekten zor bir şey söyledi.

Steam (ST): ...In short, even if she makes it so I never had older siblings, that wouldn't remove my pain... Maybe that's what she's saying.
Umineko Project (UP): ...In short, even if she makes it so that I never had elder siblings, the pain wouldn't be removed, maybe that's what she's saying.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...In short, even if she makes it so that I never had older siblings, the pain wouldn't be removed, maybe that's what she's saying.
PC Japanese (JP): …早い話が、兄と姉をいなかったことにしても痛みは取り除かれない、という意味なのかもしれません。
Russian (RU): ...Одним словом, даже если она сделает так, что у меня никогда не было старших братьев и старшей сестры, эта боль не исчезнет... Возможно, она это хочет сказать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Essencialmente, mesmo se ela fizer com que eu nunca tenha tido irmãos, a dor não vai ser removida, talvez seja o que ela está dizendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …說得簡單點的話，那就是即使沒有了哥哥姐姐，痛楚也是無法消除的，……沒准她是這個意思。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …说得简单点的话，那就是即使没有了哥哥姐姐，痛楚也是无法消除的，……没准她是这个意思。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... In poche parole, anche se cambiasse le cose in modo che io non abbia mai avuto dei fratelli più grandi, il dolore non sparirà, forse è questo che sta dicendo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In parole povere, il dolore non se ne sarebbe andato via, anche facendo in modo che io non avessi mai avuto dei fratelli maggiori... Forse era questo il senso.
Turkish (TR): ...Kısacası, hiç büyük kardeşimin olmamasını sağlasa bile, acım ortadan kalkmayacaktı, söylemek istediği belki de budur.

Steam (ST): Strictly speaking, that's not quite right. Healing isn't the same thing as removing pain. It's the pleasure we earn as compensation for withstanding pain.
Umineko Project (UP): Strictly speaking, it's different.{n}Healing isn't the same thing as removing pain.{n}It's the pleasure earned for withstanding pain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Strictly speaking, it's different. Healing isn't the same thing as removing pain. It's the pleasure earned from withstanding pain.
PC Japanese (JP): 厳密には違う。癒しとは痛みを取り除くことではない。痛みに耐えた対価として支払われる快楽なのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 厳密には違う。{n}癒しとは痛みを取り除くことではない。{n}痛みに耐えた対価として支払われる快楽なのだ。
Russian (RU): Точнее говоря, это другое.{n}Исцеление — это не то же самое, что снятие боли.{n}Это удовольствие, полученное от вынесенной боли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Estritamente falando, é diferente.{n}Curar não é a mesma coisa que remover a dor.{n}É o prazer recebido por resistir à dor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嚴格來說，並不是這樣。{n}治癒並非是消除痛楚。{n}而是作為忍耐疼痛的代價，得到的同等快樂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 严格来说，并不是这样。{n}治愈并非是消除痛楚。{n}而是作为忍耐疼痛的代价，得到的同等快乐。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ad essere precisi, ci sono delle differenze. Guarire non equivale ad eliminare il dolore. Guarire è il piacere che si guadagna dall'aver sopportato il dolore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non era esattamente così.{n}Guarire non significa asportare via il dolore.{n}È il piacere che si ottiene una volta averlo patito.
Turkish (TR): Kesin konuşmak gerekirse, farklı şeyler.{n}İyileşmek acıyı yok etmekle aynı şey değildir.{n}Acıya göğüs gererek kazanılan bir zevktir.

Steam (ST): Therefore, removing the pain isn't healing. To know the joy of healing, you have to know the pain.
Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, there can be no healing without pain.{n}To know the joy of healing, you have to know the pain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, removing the pain isn't healing. To know the joy of healing, you have to know the pain.
PC Japanese (JP): ゆえに、痛みなくして癒しはない。癒しの悦びを知るには、痛みを知らなくてはならないのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ゆえに、痛みなくして癒しはない。{n}癒しの悦びを知るには、痛みを知らなくてはならないのだ。
Russian (RU): Поэтому снятие боли не станет исцелением.{n}Чтобы познать радость исцеления, ты должна познать боль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim sendo, não tem como ser curada sem dor.{n}Para conhecer a alegria de ser curada, você precisa conhecer a dor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，沒有痛楚就沒有治癒。{n}要嘗到治癒的歡悅，必須先體味什麼叫痛苦。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，没有痛楚就没有治愈。{n}要尝到治愈的欢悦，必须先体味什么叫痛苦。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, eliminare il dolore non equivale a guarire. Per conoscere la gioia di guarire, devi conoscere prima il dolore.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per cui, eliminare il dolore non equivale a guarire.{n}Per conoscere la gioia della guarigione, occorre prima conoscere il dolore.
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla acı olmadan iyileşme de olmaz.{n}İyileşmenin keyfini anlamak için acıyı bilmek zorundasınız.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Which means...you must know joy, in order to compensate you for your pain. You should be proud of your past sufferings. After all, they are what make it possible for you to know pleasure that those without pain will never experience. ...Those who experience this pleasure...cannot help but pass on the same joy to others... *cackle*cackle*..."
Umineko Project (UP): "In that case, ......you will require joy that compensates for your pain. You can feel proud of the past you have suffered. Because you are qualified to know a kind of pleasure that those who have not known suffering cannot taste. ...Those that have known this pleasure cannot help but give the same joy to others... *cackle*cackle*..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "In that case, ......there is joy as a reward for your pain. You can boast of the suffering in your past. Because you are qualified to know a kind of pleasure that those who have not known suffering cannot taste. ...Those that have known this pleasure, cannot help but give the same joy to other people... *cackle*cackle*..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「となれば、……そなたの痛みに報いる悦びがいる。そなたは苦難の過去を誇っていい。苦難を知らぬ者には味わえぬ快楽を知る資格があるからだ。…この快楽を知る者は、同じ悦びを他者にも与えずにはいられなくなる…。くっくっくっく…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「となれば、……そなたの痛みに報いる悦びがいる。そなたは苦難の過去を誇っていい。苦難を知らぬ者には味わえぬ快楽を知る資格があるからだ。…この快楽を知る者は、同じ悦びを他者にも与えずにはいられなくなる…。くっくっくっく…」
Russian (RU): "В таком случае... возникает радость награды за свою боль. Ты можешь похвастаться пережитыми в прошлом страданиями. Поскольку у тебя есть опыт, чтобы познать такого рода удовольствие, те, кто не познал страдания, не могут ощутить этот вкус. ...Познавшие же это удовольствие не могут не поделиться такой же радостью с другими людьми... *хихи*хихи*..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nesse caso, ......é necessário que você conheça a alegria para compensar sua dor. Você sentirá orgulho do passado que sofreu. Porque você é qualificada para conhecer um tipo de prazer que aqueles que não sofreram não podem saborear. ...Aqueles que conhecerem esse prazer não podem fazer nada além de dar a mesma alegria aos outros... *gargalhada*gargalhada*..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「如此說來，……汝就是需要回報汝之痛楚的歡悅了。為汝那苦難的過去自豪吧。因為汝有了資格，去獲知那不知苦難之人無法嘗到的快樂。…獲知此種快樂之人，會情不自禁地將同樣的歡悅帶給其他人哦…。呵呵呵呵…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「如此说来，……汝就是需要回报汝之痛楚的欢悦了。为汝那苦难的过去自豪吧。因为汝有了资格，去获知那不知苦难之人无法尝到的快乐。…获知此种快乐之人，会情不自禁地将同样的欢悦带给其他人哦…。呵呵呵呵…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "In tal caso... la ricompensa per il tuo dolore sarà la gioia. Puoi vantarti delle sofferenze del tuo passato. Perché hai i requisiti per conoscere un tipo di piacere che coloro che ignorano la sofferenza non possono assaporare. ... Quelli che hanno conosciuto questo piacere, non possono fare a meno di elargire la stessa gioia ad altri... *cackle*cackle*..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "In questo modo... verrai ripagata per il tuo dolore tramite la felicità.{n}Potrai essere fiera per le avversità del tuo passato. Avrai i requisiti per sperimentare un piacere che non può essere assaporato da chi non conosce afflizione... Coloro che hanno conosciuto tale piacere non possono fare a meno di elargire la stessa gioia agli altri... Mhmhmhmh..."
Turkish (TR): "Bu nedenle, ......çektiğin acıyı telafi edecek bir neşeye ihtiyacın olacak. Geçmişte çekmiş olduğun acılarla gurur duymalısın. Çünkü sen, acı çekmenin ne olduğunu bilmeyenlerin tadamayacağı türden bir zevki tatmaya hak kazandın. ...Bu zevki tatmış olanlar, başkalarına da aynı zevki vermekten kendilerini alamazlar... *cackle*cackle*..."

Steam (ST): When the witch snapped her fingers, even though the room was still filled with a mountain of gold and had already lost all semblance of reality, a fabulous tablecloth appeared on top of the table... and a wonderful meal was laid out, almost as though it was the opening of a banquet in a castle from some fairy tale.
Umineko Project (UP): The witch snapped her fingers, and even though the room was still filled with a mountain of gold, and was already like something from another world, a fabulous tablecloth appeared on top of the table, and wonderful cooking was laid out, almost as though it was the opening of a banquet in a castle from some fairy tale.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the witch snapped her fingers, even though the room was still filled with a mountain of gold and had already lost all semblance of reality, a fabulous tablecloth appeared on top of the table, and wonderful cooking was laid out, almost as though it was the opening of a banquet in a castle from some fairy tale.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女が指を弾くと、山成す黄金の囲まれた、ただでさえ現実感を喪失しそうな部屋のまま、テーブルの上に豪華なテーブルクロスが現れ、まるでおとぎ話の中のお城で繰り広げられている宴席のような素晴らしい料理が並びました。
Russian (RU): Когда ведьма щелкнула пальцами, то в комнате, заваленной горой золота и уже казавшейся нереальной, на столе возникла сказочная скатерть с разложенными на ней удивительными блюдами, словно это было начало пира в замке из какой‐нибудь сказки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa estalou os dedos, e mesmo a sala já estando preenchida por uma montanha de ouro, o que já era como algo de outro mundo, uma fabulosa toalha de mesa apareceu sobre a mesa e uma cozinha maravilhosa foi planejada, quase como se fosse a abertura de um banquete de um castelo de algum conto de fadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女彈了下手指，在這到處是堆成山的黃金，而且光是如此就已快喪失現實感的房間中，桌上冒出了豪華的桌布，上面還排著一盤盤美味佳餚，就宛如童話故事中城堡裡舉行的宴會一般。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女弹了下手指，在这到处是堆成山的黄金，而且光是如此就已快丧失现实感的房间中，桌上冒出了豪华的桌布，上面还排着一盘盘美味佳肴，就宛如童话故事中城堡里举行的宴会一般。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando la strega schioccò le dita, nonostante la stanza fosse ancora occupata da una montagna d'oro e avesse già perso ogni aspetto realistico, una fantastica tovaglia apparve sul tavolo, e vi furono disposte pietanze meravigliose, come nell'apertura di un banchetto in un castello da favola.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La strega schioccò le dita, e all'interno della stanza, ancora circondata da una montagna d'oro, e in cui ogni senso della realtà era ormai venuto meno, apparve una suntuosa tovaglia che ricoprì il tavolo, e vennero poste in fila pietanze meravigliose, come se stesse venendo inaugurato un banchetto tenuto in un castello di una fiaba.
Turkish (TR): Cadı parmaklarını şıklattı ve oda hâlâ bir altın dağıyla kaplı olduğundan başka bir dünyadan fırlamış gibi görünse de, masanın üzerinde olağanüstü güzellikte bir masa örtüsü belirdi, ve neredeyse bir peri masalındaki şatoda verilen bir ziyafetin açılışını andıran şahane yemekler ortaya dizildi.

Steam (ST): For an instant, Rosa truly did feel a pleasurable surprise at how fabulous it was, ...but at the same time, she felt a bit of anticlimax.
Umineko Project (UP): For an instant, Rosa felt a pleasurable surprise at how fabulous it was, ...but at the same time, she felt a bit of anticlimax.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For an instant, Rosa felt a pleasurable surprise at how fabulous it was, ...but at the same time, she felt a bit of anticlimax.
PC Japanese (JP): その豪華さに、楼座は確かに一瞬、嬉しい驚きを感じましたが、…同時に拍子抜けも感じました。
Russian (RU): На мгновение, Роза ощутила приятное удивление от сказочности этого зрелища... но в то же время она испытала лёгкое разочарование.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por um instante, Rosa sentiu uma prazerosa surpresa ao ver o quão fabuloso era, ...mas, ao mesmo tempo, ela sentiu um pouco de desapontamento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這份豪華，確確實實讓樓座感到了一瞬的驚喜，…但是，同時也使她泄了氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这份豪华，确确实实让楼座感到了一瞬的惊喜，…但是，同时也使她泄了气。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per un istante, Rosa avvertì una piacevole sensazione di sorpresa davanti a tanta magnificenza... ma allo stesso tempo, era un po' delusa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dinanzi a tale sfarzo, per un attimo Rosa rimase senz'altro piacevolmente sorpresa... ma al tempo stesso, si sentì delusa.
Turkish (TR): Rosa bir an için bunun ne kadar muhteşem olduğuna dair hoş bir şaşkınlık hissetti, ...ama aynı zamanda biraz da hayal kırıklığı hissetti.

Steam (ST): After all, she didn't think being bullied by her siblings could be wiped away by just one meal, no matter how delicious.
Umineko Project (UP): Because she found herself thinking that being bullied by her siblings...couldn't be wiped away by just one meal, no matter how delicious.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because she thought that being bullied by her siblings wouldn't be wiped away by just one meal, no matter how delicious.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分にとって、兄弟に虐められてきたことは、どんなものであれ、一食程度の美食では拭い去れないものだと思っていたからです。
Russian (RU): Поскольку она подумала, что издевательства её братьев и сестры не заставит позабыть никакая еда, насколько бы вкусной она ни была.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque ela se encontrou pensando que ter sido maltratada pelos irmãos...não poderia ser apagado por uma simples refeição, não importando o quão deliciosa ela fosse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為她覺得對自己來說，一直以來從哥哥姐姐那所受的欺負，無論算做什麼，都不是一餐美食就能抹消的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为她觉得对自己来说，一直以来从哥哥姐姐那所受的欺负，无论算做什么，都不是一餐美食就能抹消的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perché pensava che non sarebbe bastato un semplice pasto per cancellare i maltrattamenti inflitti a lei dai suoi fratelli, anche se fosse stato il pasto più delizioso del mondo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Questo perché il cibo a lei servito, a prescindere da quanto sarebbe stato saporito, non sarebbe mai riuscito a cancellare le vessazioni subite da parte dei suoi fratelli.
Turkish (TR): Çünkü kendini, kardeşleri tarafından zorbalığa uğramanın ne kadar lezzetli olursa olsun...tek bir yemekle silinip atılamayacağını düşünürken buldu.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Food is the source of many human pleasures. You simply must eat like a pig as long as you live."
Umineko Project (UP): "Food contains many of the human pleasures. You must eat like a pig as long as you live."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「食は人の快楽の多くを占める。生涯、生き続ける限り豚のように食い続けなくてはならぬ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「食は人の快楽の多くを占める。生涯、生き続ける限り豚のように食い続けなくてはならぬ」
Russian (RU): "Еда — источник многих человеческих наслаждений. Вам приходится обжираться как свиньям, пока вы живёте."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A comida contém muitos dos prazeres humanos. Você pode comer como um porco, contanto que esteja viva."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「食佔據了人之快樂中相當大的比重。一生之中，只要活著就必須像豬那樣不停地吃。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「食占据了人之快乐中相当大的比重。一生之中，只要活着就必须像猪那样不停地吃。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Il cibo racchiude molti dei piaceri umani. Devi ingozzarti come un maiale fintanto che sei in vita."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Il cibo racchiude in sé molti dei piaceri umani. Finché si è in vita, bisogna continuare ad ingozzarsi come un maiale."
Turkish (TR): "Yiyecekler, insan zevklerinin büyük bir kısmını içerir. Yaşadığın sürece bir domuz gibi yemelisin."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "If one meal isn't enough, then have as many as you want. Until the pain of your heart is healed, why not continue this gourmet banquet? ...Begin it, furniture."
Umineko Project (UP): "If one meal isn't enough, then as many as you want. Let us continue this gourmet banquet until the pain of your heart is healed. ......Begin, furniture."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "If one meal isn't enough, then as many as you want. Until the pain of your heart is healed, why not continue this gourmet banquet? ......Begin it, furniture."
PC Japanese (JP): 「一食で足りなければいくらでも。その心の痛みが癒えるまで、美食の宴を続けようではないか。……始めろ、家具ども。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「一食で足りなければいくらでも。その心の痛みが癒えるまで、美食の宴を続けようではないか。……始めろ、家具ども」
Russian (RU): "Если одного блюда не хватит, то бери сколько пожелаешь. Пока боль твоего сердца не пройдёт, почему бы не продолжить этот пир для гурманов? ......Начинайте, мебель."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se uma refeição não for o suficiente, então coma quantas precisar. Vamos continuar o nosso banquete gourmet até que a dor em seu coração seja curada. ......Comecem, mobílias."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「一餐不夠的話無論多少次都行。在治癒了汝那心痛之前，就將美食之宴不停地繼續下去吧。……開始吧，家具們。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「一餐不够的话无论多少次都行。在治愈了汝那心痛之前，就将美食之宴不停地继续下去吧。……开始吧，家具们。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Se un solo pasto non è abbastanza, allora abbine quanti ne vuoi. Perché non continuare questo banchetto raffinato fino a che il dolore del tuo cuore non sarà guarito? ... Iniziate, mobili."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Se un pasto non basterà, allora mangiane quanti ne vuoi. Proseguiamo questo banchetto gourmet fino a quando il dolore del tuo cuore non sarà guarito... Aprite le danze, mobili."
Turkish (TR): "Bir öğün yetmiyorsa, dilediğin kadar ye. Kalbinin acısı iyileşene kadar bu gurme ziyafetini sürdürelim. ......Başlayın, mobilyalar."

Steam (ST): As the witch clapped twice, there were suddenly two goat head servants there, and they began to prepare the meal.
Umineko Project (UP): As the witch clapped twice, there were suddenly goat‐head servants there, and they began to prepare the meal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the witch clapped twice, there were suddenly two goat head servants there, and they began to prepare the meal.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女が手をパンパンと叩くと、いつの間にか周りには山羊頭の使用人たちがいて、食事の準備を始めていました。
Russian (RU): Как только ведьма дважды хлопнула в ладоши, тут же появилось два козлоголовых слуги, и они стали накладывать еду.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a bruxa bateu palmas duas vezes, subitamente, servos com cabeças de cabra apareceram e começaram a preparar o jantar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女“啪啪”地一拍手，周圍就在不知不覺間冒出了頂著山羊頭的傭人，開始了備餐。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女“啪啪”地一拍手，周围就在不知不觉间冒出了顶着山羊头的佣人，开始了备餐。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando la strega batté le mani due volte, apparvero due servi con le teste di caproni, e questi iniziarono a preparare il pasto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La strega battè due volte le mani, e dal nulla apparvero due servitori con la testa di capra, i quali iniziarono a imbastire i piatti.
Turkish (TR): Cadı iki kez el çırptığında, birdenbire keçi kafalı hizmetkârlar ortaya çıkarak yemeği hazırlamaya başladılar.

Steam (ST): From the beautiful dishes adorning the table, they efficiently took some food and began to pile it up on Rosa's plate.
Umineko Project (UP): From the beautiful food dishes adorning the table, they efficiently took some food and began to pile it up on Rosa's plate.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): From the beautiful food dishes adorning the table, they efficiently took some food and began to pile it up on Rosa's plate.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らはテーブルを飾る美しき料理皿から、要領よく料理を取り、楼座の皿を盛り上げていきました。
Russian (RU): Они аккуратно взяли немного еды из красивых тарелок, украшающих стол, и стали накладывать её на тарелку Розе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dos lindos pratos de comida que adornavam a mesa, eficientemente eles começaram a servir um pouco de comida que era empilhada no prato de Rosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們從那裝點著桌子的、頗為美觀的盤子中，不多不少地盛來料理，添到樓座的盤子裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们从那装点着桌子的、颇为美观的盘子中，不多不少地盛来料理，添到楼座的盘子里。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prelevarono con efficienza del cibo dagli splendidi piatti da portata che ornavano il tavolo, e presero a depositarlo nel piatto di Rosa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Essi prelevavano con professionalità il cibo posto sui magnifici piatti da portata che ornavano il tavolo, per poi depositarlo nel piatto di Rosa.
Turkish (TR): Masayı süsleyen güzel yemek tabaklarından ustalıkla yiyecekler alarak Rosa'nın tabağına istiflemeye başladılar.

Steam (ST): It really did look delicious, but Rosa's body still felt as heavy as lead, and there was no way she'd be able to eat.
Umineko Project (UP): It really did look delicious, but Rosa's body still felt as heavy as lead, and there was no way she could eat.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It really did look delicious, but Rosa's body still felt as heavy as lead, and there was no way she could eat.
PC Japanese (JP): 確かにおいしそうでしたが、楼座の体はまだ鉛のように重くて、とても食事どころではありませんでした。
Russian (RU): Она действительно выглядела очень вкусно, но Роза до сих пор ощущала себя тяжёлой как свинец и совсем никак не могла есть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Realmente parecia delicioso, mas o corpo de Rosa se sentia pesado, e não havia como ela conseguir comer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然確實是看起來很好吃，但樓座的身體還如鉛般沉重，遠不是吃飯的時候。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然确实是看起来很好吃，但楼座的身体还如铅般沉重，远不是吃饭的时候。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Aveva veramente un aspetto delizioso, ma a Rosa sembrava ancora che il suo corpo fosse pesante come il piombo, e mangiare le sarebbe stato impossibile.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Aveva sicuramente un aspetto delizioso, ma Rosa si sentiva ancora pesante come il piombo, e non sarebbe mai riuscita a mangiare.
Turkish (TR): Gerçekten de lezzetli görünüyorlardı ama Rosa'nın vücudu hâlâ kurşun gibi ağırdı, bu yüzden yiyebilmesinin imkânı yoktu.

Steam (ST): Maybe they also understood that.
Umineko Project (UP): Maybe they also understood that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe they also understood that.
PC Japanese (JP): それは彼らにもわかっているのでしょう。
Russian (RU): Возможно, они тоже поняли это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez eles também entendessem isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們也是明白這點吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们也是明白这点吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Forse anche loro lo capirono.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Forse anche loro l'avevano compreso.
Turkish (TR): Belki onlar da bunu anlamışlardı.

Steam (ST): The goat head servants tied a napkin around Rosa's collar... and gallantly brought a glass of before-dinner alcohol to her mouth, tilting it for her.
Umineko Project (UP): The goat‐head servants tied a napkin around Rosa's collar, and gallantly brought a glass of before‐dinner alcohol to her mouth, and even tilted it for her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The goat head servants tied a napkin around Rosa's collar, and gallantly brought a glass of before-dinner alcohol to her mouth, tilting it for her.
PC Japanese (JP): 山羊頭の使用人たちは、楼座の襟元にナプキンを纏わせ、甲斐甲斐しく、食前酒のグラスを口元まで持ってきて傾けてまでくれました。
Russian (RU): Козлоголовый слуга повязал салфетку вокруг шеи Розы, и галантно поднёс бокал спиртного, выпиваемого перед едой в качестве закуски, к её рту, наклонив его для неё.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os servos com cabeças de cabra amarraram um guardanapo ao longo do colarinho de Rosa, e galantemente trouxeram um copo de álcool anterior ao jantar à sua boca, e até o inclinaram para ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 山羊頭傭人們，在樓座的領子上纏上餐巾，勤快地將盛著餐前酒的杯子拿到她嘴邊，輕輕傾斜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 山羊头佣人们，在楼座的领子上缠上餐巾，勤快地将盛着餐前酒的杯子拿到她嘴边，轻轻倾斜。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I servi con la testa di caprone sistemarono un tovagliolo attorno al collo di Rosa, e le portarono alla bocca un bicchiere di aperitivo con gentilezza, inclinandolo appena per lei.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): I servitori dalla testa caprina misero attorno al collo di Rosa un tovagliolo, e con diligenza, le portarono una bevanda da aperitivo, inclinandogliela verso la sua bocca.
Turkish (TR): Keçi kafalı hizmetkârlar Rosa'nın yakasına bir peçete bağladılar, ve kibarca bir kadeh içkiyi Rosa'nın ağzına götürüp içmesine yardım ettiler.

Steam (ST): She remembered an old servant who had once carried rice porridge to her mouth when she was laid up with a high fever.
Umineko Project (UP): She remembered an old servant who had once carried rice porridge to her mouth when she was laid up with a high fever.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She remembered an old servant who had once carried rice porridge to her mouth when she was laid up with a high fever.
PC Japanese (JP): 高熱で寝込んだ時に、おかゆを口元まで運んでくれた古い使用人の姿を思い出します。
Russian (RU): Она вспомнила старого слугу, который одно время подносил рисовую кашу к её рту, когда она лежала с высокой температурой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela lembrou dos antigos serviçais que uma vez davam mingau de arroz na sua boca quando ela estava com febre e deitada na cama.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座想起了很久以前自己發高燒臥床不起時，將熱水送到自己嘴邊的老傭人的身影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座想起了很久以前自己发高烧卧床不起时，将热水送到自己嘴边的老佣人的身影。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa ricordò che una volta una vecchia domestica le aveva imboccato del porridge di riso quando era a letto con la febbre alta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Rosa si ricordò di una domestica anziana, che le aveva imboccato della pappa di riso quando era rimasta allettata per una febbre alta.
Turkish (TR): Rosa, bir keresinde yüksek ateş içinde yatarken ağzına pirinç lapası veren yaşlı bir hizmetkârı hatırladı.

Steam (ST): She couldn't drink it well, and it dripped down from her mouth, but she felt the fragrant sweetness spread throughout her mouth.
Umineko Project (UP): She couldn't drink it well, and it dripped down from her mouth, but she felt the fragrant sweetness spread throughout her mouth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She couldn't drink it well, and it dripped down from her mouth, but she felt the fragrant sweetness spread throughout her mouth.
PC Japanese (JP): 上手に飲めず、口元から零してしまいましたが、芳香のある甘さが口の中いっぱいに広がるのを感じました。
Russian (RU): Она не могла как следует её кушать, и та капала из её рта, но она ощущала душистую сладость, разносящуюся в полости рта.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não podia beber direito, então acabou derramando, mas ela sentiu um fragmento de doçura se espalhar por sua boca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然沒能好好喝下，從嘴角邊流了出來，但那帶有芳香的甘甜在樓座口中大幅地遍佈了開來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然没能好好喝下，从嘴角边流了出来，但那带有芳香的甘甜在楼座口中大幅地遍布了开来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non era stata in grado di mangiarlo per bene, e le era colato fuori dalla bocca, ma ne aveva comunque sentito la fragrante dolcezza riempirle gradualmente la bocca.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non riusciva a berlo bene, e le colava fuori dalla bocca, ma era comunque riuscita a sentire il palato riempirsi di quella fragrante dolcezza.
Turkish (TR): Tam olarak içemediğinden dudaklarından aşağı damlıyordu ama güzel kokulu tatlılığın ağzına yayıldığını hissedebiliyordu.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "It's a sweet aperitif of noble rot German-made wine. A wine cocktail of white wine mixed with a crimson golden drop."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's a sweet aperitif of noble rot German‐made wine. A wine cocktail of white wine tinged with crimson golden drops."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It's a sweet aperitif of noble rot German-made wine. A wine cocktail of white wine mixed with a crimson golden drop."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ドイツ産の貴腐ワインにあやかった甘きアペリティフよ。白ワインを紅きゴールデンドロップで染めたワインカクテルだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ドイツ産の貴腐ワインにあやかった甘きアペリティフよ。白ワインを紅きゴールデンドロップで染めたワインカクテルだ」
Russian (RU): "Это сладкий аперитив благородного перебродившего немецкого вина. Винный коктейль белого вина, смешанный с багрово золотой каплей."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É um doce aperitivo de um adocicado vinho alemão envelhecido. Um coquetel de vinho branco tingido com gotas douradas carmesim."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這可是與德國產貴腐酒相仿的甜味餐前酒喲。是以紅色黃金凝液來給白葡萄酒配色的雞尾酒。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这可是与德国产贵腐酒相仿的甜味餐前酒哟。是以红色黄金凝液来给白葡萄酒配色的鸡尾酒。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È un aperitivo dolce costituito da un vino muffato tedesco. Un cocktail composto da vino bianco mischiato ad una golden drop color cremisi."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Questo è un aperitivo dolce, ispirato dai vin brulé tedeschi. Un cocktail di vino bianco, a cui è stato aggiunto un tocco finale di scarlatto."
Turkish (TR): "Alman yapımı Noble Rot şarabının tatlı bir aperatifi. Kızıl altın damlalarla zenginleştirilmiş beyaz şaraptan oluşan bir şarap kokteyli."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "If I had to give it a name, I'd call it a Bloody Krauss. Soaked with just a golden drop of your brother's blood that was squeezed out of a compressor."
Umineko Project (UP): "If I had to give it a name, I'd call it a Bloody Krauss. The color comes solely from golden drops of your brother's blood, obtained by placing him in a compressor."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "If I had to give it a name, I'd call it a Bloody Krauss. Soaked with just a golden drop of your brother's blood that was squeezed out of a compressor."
PC Japanese (JP): 「名付けるならばブラッディ・クラウスか。そなたの兄を圧搾機に掛けて搾り出した血のゴールデンドロップだけで染めてある。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「名付けるならばブラッディ・クラウスか。そなたの兄を圧搾機に掛けて搾り出した血のゴールデンドロップだけで染めてある」
Russian (RU): "Если бы мне пришлось дать ему имя, я бы назвала его Кровавый Краусс. Пропитан золотыми каплями крови твоего братца, побывавшего в соковыжималке."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se eu tivesse que dar um nome, eu chamaria de {i:Bloody Krauss}. A cor vem de douradas e únicas gotas do sangue de seu irmão, obtidas colocando‐o em um compressor."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「要冠名的話，那就叫作{ruby:Bloody Krauss:血腥藏臼}吧。這是將汝的兄長放進壓榨機中，並只用榨出來的血之黃金凝液染紅的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「要冠名的话，那就叫作{ruby:Bloody Krauss:血腥藏臼}吧。这是将汝的兄长放进压榨机中，并只用榨出来的血之黄金凝液染红的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Se dovessi attribuirgli un nome, lo chiamerei Bloody Krauss. Arricchito con una singola golden drop del sangue di tuo fratello che è stato spremuto con un compressore."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Se dovessi dargli un nome, lo chiamerei ‘Bloody Klaus’. È stato intinto unicamente con le ultime gocce del sangue di tuo fratello, ricavate spremendolo con un torchio."
Turkish (TR): "Eğer buna bir isim vermem gerekseydi, Kanlı Krauss derdim. Rengi ise tamamen kardeşinin kompresöre konularak elde edilen kanının altın damlalarından geliyor."
